author: calvix.
content: Are there already any `hoodi`  MEV relays that can be used?

author: parithosh
content: not yet, they are in the process of being spun up.

author: prestonvanloon
content: When did we agree on changing the EOL date and LTS window for Holesky? I just saw the EF blog post saying that it is changed

author: parithosh
content:
During the testing call mostly, there was interest to not have an ever increasing number of testnets. The testing call particularly wanted to look at having holesky as the core dev testnet, but as external parties migrate off of it to holesky, we'd be left running the whole thing. We asked all the validators who intend to abandon to handover keys to us and we'd continue running it. (core dev testnet also partially implies we don't need to support it in an outward facing manner)

Would there be any need for keeping holesky around for longer than half a year? It feels like we'd have learnt everything about exit queue dynamics by then and we can still use it for non-finality tests until then, perhaps even break it irrepariably at the end

author: prestonvanloon
content: which call was this? I'd like to review the notes. I am just concerned that we had communicated EOL/LTS then we are changing it. I didn't realize hoodi is the replacement for holesky either, i thought it was a temporary testnet until holesky reaches a mainnet size state again then we would stick to the EOL schedule

author: _shemnon
content: What materially changes is that holesky will not be able to do exits until sometime next year.  I read EOL/LTS plans as "if nothing catastrophic happens" and something catastrophic happened (> 2/3 byzantine fault)

author: parithosh
content:
[notes from testing call about holesky deprecation](https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/interop-testing-call-29-mar-17-2025/23168)

[notes from ACD last week about hoodi being long lived testnet](https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/all-core-devs-execution-acde-207/23020/2#p-56194-action-items-next-steps-1)

author: parithosh
content:
Also if holesky is not able to do exits, lido already announced that they are abandoning holesky in order to spin up hoodi support faster (As have other staking providers). So at that point, holesky isn't serving its original purpose anymore - hence the lack of urgency to keep it around longer than reasonable. 

I'm happy to revise the deprecation timeline if that's the issue, 6 months was just a suggestion - it may have well been 1y. However i do want to be vary of time spent in co-ordinating and keeping around a network that isn't being used.

author: remyroy
content: The hoodi explorer on <https://explorer.hoodi.ethpandaops.io/address/0x4D496CcC28058B1D74B7a19541663E21154f9c84> seems to be struggling. If you check that page for instance, I can't get the details of that wallet. Any work to improve it would be appreciated.

author: parithosh
content: Yeah agreed! we'll look into it, but it was just a temp instance till etherscan comes up (waiting on client releases)

author: remyroy
content: There is a working one on <https://hoodi.launchpad.ethstaker.cc/> until the main official one is launched. There is also a staging one on <https://deploy-preview-745--dapper-rolypoly-9814ad.netlify.app/>.
